purpose: Define the operational boundary of WyneOS and clarify responsibilities shared with external systems and operators.

wyneosResponsibilities.governance: Evaluate actions through the governance model and apply policy rules.
wyneosResponsibilities.integrity: Protect system files, manifests, and seals from unauthorised change.
wyneosResponsibilities.telemetry: Provide heartbeat, integrity, and sync telemetry.
wyneosResponsibilities.predictiveFunctions: Generate predictive insights to support operational decisions.
wyneosResponsibilities.optimisation: Improve system behaviour through analysis and adjustments.
wyneosResponsibilities.emergentBehaviour: Produce controlled emergent behaviour through Phase 9 processes.
wyneosResponsibilities.auditChain: Maintain logs and chain of custody for system evidence.
wyneosResponsibilities.runtime: Offer controlled PowerShell and Node runtime environments.

externalResponsibilities.infrastructure: Provide stable compute, storage, and execution environment.
externalResponsibilities.backup: Perform off-system backup or archiving, if required.
externalResponsibilities.securityControls: Apply external security measures such as firewalls and access control.
externalResponsibilities.deployment: Manage hosting, deployment, and operational lifecycle.
externalResponsibilities.monitoring: Monitor system telemetry outputs and take action when required.

outOfScope.userAuthentication: WyneOS does not manage authentication for end-users or operators.
outOfScope.networkSecurity: External systems must apply their own network protection.
outOfScope.externalAPIs: Not included in v1.0. API support planned for future versions.
outOfScope.dataProcessing: WyneOS does not store or process end-user data beyond system telemetry.

requirements: Ability to read version and capability files.
